name: Android-MCP
description: Lightweight MCP Server for Android Operating System
long_description:
Android-MCP is a lightweight, open-source tool that bridge between AI agents and Android devices. Running as an MCP server, it lets LLM agents perform real-world tasks such as **app navigation, UI interaction and automated QA testing** without relying on traditional computer-vision pipelines or preprogramed scripts.

**KEY FEATURES**
- **Native Android Integration**: Interact with UI elements via ADB and the Android Accessibility API.
- **Bring Your Own LLM/VLM**: Works with any language model.
- **Rich Toolset for Mobile Automation**: Pre-built tools for gestures, keystrokes, capture, device state, etc.
- **Real-Time Interaction**: Typical latency between actions ranges 2-4s.

**MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS**
- Python 3.13 or higher
- Android Debug Bridge (ADB)
Ensure ADB is installed and your device is connected/authorized.
- UV Package Manager
This MCP server requires UV, a fast Python package manager.
Installation:
`curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh`
For detailed installation instructions, [see the UV documentation](https://github.com/astral-sh/uv)

tools.name: Click
tools.description: Click on a specific cordinate (x, y).

tools.name: Snapshot
tools.description: Get the state of the device. Optionally includes visual screenshot when use_vision=True. Returns tree state string and screenshot if requested.

tools.name: LongClick
tools.description: Long click on a specific cordinate (x, y).

tools.name: Swipe
tools.description: Swipe from one coordinate (x1, y1) to another (x2, y2).

tools.name: Type
tools.description: Type text on a specific cordinate (x, y). Can clear existing text if clear=True.

tools.name: Drag
tools.description: Drag from location (x1, y1) and drop on another location (x2, y2).

tools.name: Press
tools.description: Press on specific button on the device (e.g. Back, Home, etc).

tools.name: Notification
tools.description: Access the notifications seen on the device.

tools.name: Wait
tools.description: Wait for a specific amount of time (seconds).
